microSituations.title: I'm Lost
actions: Find nearest metro station (look for red/green line signs)
Use RTA Dubai app or Google Maps
Ask at info desk or police station
Look for major landmarks (Burj Khalifa, Dubai Mall, Burj Al Arab)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't panic - Dubai is modern and well-marked. Metro is efficient.

microSituations.title: Public Transport
actions: Get Nol card (silver/gold) - AED 2-7.50 per ride
Daily cap AED 14 (unlimited travel after that)
Taxis: AED 5 base + AED 1.82/km (cheaper than Uber)
Metro runs 5am-midnight, avoid rush hour 7-9am and 5-7pm
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid taxis during rush hour. Metro is faster and cheaper.

microSituations.title: Taxi / Ride Share
actions: Taxis: meter required, cheaper than Uber
Use metro during rush hour (avoid traffic)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Use metro for most trips. Taxis only for late night or specific destinations.

microSituations.title: Quick Bite
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't eat at tourist trap restaurants. Food courts are cheaper.

microSituations.title: Sit-Down Meal
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Eat lunch like locals (12-2pm) for best deals. Dinner after 7pm.

microSituations.title: Dietary Restrictions
actions: Tap water safe but bottled preferred
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume - always ask. Dubai restaurants are very accommodating.

microSituations.title: 15-30 Minutes
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't rush. Dubai is best experienced slowly.

microSituations.title: 1-2 Hours
actions: Al Fahidi Historical District (free, old Dubai)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid midday heat (11am-4pm). Early morning or evening is better.

microSituations.title: Half Day
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. Pick one area and explore deeply.

microSituations.title: Safety Concern
actions: Dubai is very safe, but trust your instincts
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Dubai is one of the safest cities, but stay alert.

microSituations.title: Scam / Suspicious
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Be polite but firm: 'La shukran' (no thanks) and keep walking.

microSituations.title: Lost Item
actions: Report to embassy if passport stolen
Cancel cards immediately if wallet stolen
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Keep copies of passport/ID separate. Use hotel safe for valuables.

microSituations.title: Essential Phrases
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't worry - English is widely spoken, but politeness matters.

microSituations.title: Ordering Food
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't be embarrassed. English works everywhere.

microSituations.title: Asking for Help
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Dubai people are very helpful. English works everywhere.

microSituations.title: Need Rest
actions: Caf√© break (coffee AED 15-25, sit as long as you want)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't push through exhaustion. Rest is part of travel.

microSituations.title: Too Many Tourists
actions: Leave main areas: walk 10min away from Dubai Mall
Al Fahidi Historical District (locals, fewer tourists)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tourist areas are crowded for a reason, but real Dubai is 2 blocks away.

microSituations.title: Overwhelmed by Choices
actions: Pick one thing: food OR shopping OR beaches
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. One great experience beats ten rushed ones.

microSituations.title: If you have 15 minutes
actions: Find a hidden souk or market
Watch people at a public area
Discover a tiny street you've never heard of

microSituations.title: If you want something social
actions: Join locals at a food court
Visit a souk and chat with vendors
Attend a local event (check local listings)

microSituations.title: If it's raining
actions: Caf√© culture: sit inside with a book

microSituations.title: If you want local flavor
actions: Al Fahidi Historical District (old Dubai, authentic)
Find a neighborhood away from tourist areas
